extracted_playbook.title: Use Strong Passwords
extracted_playbook.description: Implement strong, hard-to-guess passwords to mitigate CVE-2024-54089.

extracted_playbook.title: Change Default Passwords
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure all three default passwords are changed even if not in use to mitigate CVE-2024-54090.

extracted_playbook.title: Disable Telnet
extracted_playbook.description: Disable Telnet to mitigate CVE-2024-54090. Note: Telnet is disabled by default.

extracted_playbook.title: Protect Network Access
extracted_playbook.description: Protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms and configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for industrial security.

extracted_playbook.title: Minimize Network Exposure
extracted_playbook.description: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, ensuring they are not accessible from the internet.

extracted_playbook.title: Locate Networks Behind Firewalls
extracted_playbook.description: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolate them from business networks.

extracted_playbook.title: Use Secure Remote Access Methods
extracted_playbook.description: When remote access is required, use more secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs). Ensure VPNs are updated to the most recent version available.

extracted_playbook.title: Perform Impact Analysis and Risk Assessment
extracted_playbook.description: Perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.

extracted_playbook.title: Report Malicious Activity
extracted_playbook.description: Follow established internal procedures and report suspected malicious activity to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.

extracted_playbook.title: Avoid Social Engineering Attacks
extracted_playbook.description: Do not click web links or open attachments in unsolicited email messages. Refer to resources on recognizing and avoiding email scams and social engineering attacks.
